page.title: 03Agriculture
page.content: Most of the parish of Marston Moretaine is low -lying,below 200 feet.The overlying soil is Oxford Clay with occasional alluvium.The area is Grade 3 agricultural land,much of which has been lost to clay workings. In the area currently being farmed it is predominantly an arable area growing winter wheat, winter barley and rape.Some pastoral areas remain for sheep and cattle such as Moat Farm, Marston which is a mixed farm, arable with sheep and around 180 head of Beef cattle which are reared inside in covered yards.
